dependencies.description:
GPyTorch is a Gaussian process library implemented using PyTorch.
GPyTorch is designed for creating scalable, flexible, and modular
Gaussian process models with ease.
dependencies.name: py-gpytorch

dependencies.description:
A linear operator implementation, primarily designed for finite-
dimensional positive definite operators (i.e. kernel matrices).
dependencies.name: py-linear-operator

dependencies.description: A relatively sane approach to multiple dispatch in Python.
dependencies.name: py-multipledispatch

dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-pip

dependencies.description: A Python library for probabilistic modeling and inference.
dependencies.name: py-pyro-ppl

dependencies.description: Fundamental algorithms for scientific computing in Python.
dependencies.name: py-scipy

dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools

dependencies.description: The blessed package to manage your versions by scm tags.
dependencies.name: py-setuptools-scm

dependencies.description:
Tensors and Dynamic neural networks in Python with strong GPU
acceleration.
dependencies.name: py-torch

dependencies.description: A Spack managed Python virtual environment
dependencies.name: python-venv

dependent_to.description:
Adaptive experimentation is the machine-learning guided process of
iteratively exploring a (possibly infinite) parameter space in order to
identify optimal configurations in a resource-efficient manner. Ax
currently supports Bayesian optimization and bandit optimization as
exploration strategies. Bayesian optimization in Ax is powered by
BoTorch, a modern library for Bayesian optimization research built on
PyTorch.
dependent_to.name: py-ax-platform

description: BoTorch is a library for Bayesian Optimization built on PyTorch.
name: py-botorch

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
